flawed_nl_solution:
You first have to calculate the total mass of apples he had on the shelves, so you add the three kinds of apples: 23 kg + 37 kg + 14 kg = <<23+37+14=74>>74kg
Since he sold 36 kg of apples, he still has: 74 kg - 36 kg = <<74-36=83>>83kg
#### 83

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 38, not 83. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
